Title: the indecision amalgamation

Scene: Sheldon You see? I don’t know. What should I do?
A film set. Penny is being fitted with gorilla hands.
Sheldon: Boy, do I have to urinate.
Seriously. I feel like I’ve got a fish tank in my pelvis.
I can’t.
Because I’m trying to decide between getting an Xbox One or a PS4. Oh, pee, why’d I say that?
I’m not being stupid. I’m employing the work of Dutch researcher, Mirjam Tuk, who found that people with full bladders make better decisions.
Here come the waterworks.

So, first there was PlayStation, aka PS1, then PS2, PS3 and now PS4. And that makes sense. You’d think after Xbox, there’d be Xbox 2. But no, next came Xbox 360. Hmm? And now, after 360, comes Xbox One. Why one? Maybe that’s how many seconds of thought they put into naming it.
You know, however, with the Xbox One, I can control my entire entertainment system using voice commands. Up until now, I’ve had to use Leonard.
Get? Hang on. I don’t feel like you’re taking this dilemma seriously.
Okay, now, the PS4 is more angular and sleek-looking.
Yeah, well, it’s true. But the larger size of the Xbox One may keep it from overheating.
No, see? Well, you absolutely would not. And furthermore, the Xbox One now comes with a Kinect included.
Yes. Not sold separately. Although the PS4 uses cool new GDDR5 RAM, while the Xbox One is still using the conventional DDR3 memory.
See? That’s what I thought. But then they go and throw in an ESRAM buffer.
Xbox.
No, I am not. And this ESRAM buffer should totally bridge the 100-gigabit-per-second bandwidth gap between the two RAM types.
Thank you again for dinner.
Good night.
Oh, of course. (They kiss) Did I mention the PS4 controllers light up?
Well, they do.
Quick poll, PS4 or Xbox One? Raj?
Penny?
Leonard?
Wolowitz?
Bernadette?
Thanks, Grandma.
You know, I’m proud of me, too. I’ve done all my research, I conducted an informal poll, and I’ve arrived at the rock-solid certainty I’ve made the right choice.
Oh, it is. Although.
I had the same feeling when I made my dad buy a Betamax instead of a VHS.
Yeah, a little kid who picked the wrong format to record The MacNeil/Lehrer Report. Now I also was certain that HD DVD would win out over Blu-ray.
Old enough to know better. You know, and now that I think about it, I stood in front of a case of iPods and I bought a Zune.
Yeah, exactly. It’s an MP3 player brought to us by the makers of Xbox.
But what if I’m wrong?
You know I only have one slot available in my entertainment centre.
Well, yeah, okay, sure. But which one?
Interesting.
All right, I’ll try.
A quarter.
On the one hand, the Xbox One has a better camera, but the PS4 has a removable hard drive. Thoughts?
But I haven’t decided yet.
Okay.
I don’t know. Hey, look, a quarter.
Leonard: If only there were a solution to that.
So go to the bathroom.
Why not?
Forgive me for asking a stupid question, but why are you being stupid?
Why did I pee before I decided to move in here?
Hey. Oh, how’d the audition go?
Oh, that’s great.
Aren’t you gonna ask?
Well, for starters, I wouldn’t eat the bananas.
Uh, uh, does it at least pay well?
What does your agent think?
You know what, why don’t you just do it? You’ll go have fun for a few weeks, make some money, and who knows what it might lead to?
Just to clarify, which one of you is wearing the bikini?
So it’s a family film.
So, are you gonna see her again?
You have my blessing. Go for it.
Okay, that’s enough.
PS4.
What’s up?
Two women at the same time? Nice job, playa.
Was it the two women thing or the playa? It was the playa.
Were you seeing other men?
Aren’t you gonna ask me?
Thank you so much for letting us pick your brain.
So, what do you think, is there a professional downside to doing it?
Sounds rough.
Okay, this was helpful.
Yes.
Penny: Hi.
I killed it. I was even able to cry real tears right on the spot.
I know. Next time I get pulled over for a speeding ticket, here come the waterworks.
What is this, my first day?
Yeah, sure.
I’m gonna go with monster. What do you got?
I’m liking my odds here.
No.
Oh. Why didn’t I put money on this? (Phone rings) Hey, that’s my agent. If I got the part, it’s still the second best thing I’ve heard all day. Hello?
No, I didn’t get it.
I kind of did. The part in that awful horror movie I passed on came back around. Apparently, it’s mine if I want it.
I don’t know what to do.
Okay, it’s not me, right? This script is terrible.
Okay. (Reading) Sometimes I feel like I can control the killer gorilla instinct inside of me, but then I see these bananas and I just want to eat them and then kill people. What am I gonna do?
No, come on. This is serious.
Less than I was making at The Cheesecake Factory.
She’s thinking of taking a job at The Cheesecake Factory.
Okay, look, here, page 58. I oil-wrestle an orang-utan in a bikini.
Both of us.
Okay, like what? Show me.
Oh, that’s sad.
Wow.
Huh?
Really?
Unless you’re sleeping with one of them, seeing other people isn’t a big deal.
No.
Come on, really?
Well, I’m having an impossible time getting my career off the ground, and I got offered a role in this crappy horror movie, and I just don’t know if I should take it.
I wouldn’t exactly call Star Trek embarrassing.
Me, either.
Yeah, beam me up. I love it.
That’s what I’m afraid of.
No. Did you figure out what you’re gonna do about the two girls?
Yes.
Great. Not like regret at all.
Bernadette: Can I get your opinion on something that happened at work today?
Okay, well, I did something that will either make me look like a lovable goof or a horrible monster damned to spend eternity in hell.
Well, there’s this lady in our office who’s retiring, and they were passing around one of those big cards for us to sign.
But no one told me she was in a horrible car accident over the weekend and what I was signing was not a retirement card but was actually a get well card.
So on the card, in the hospital, next to the woman who’s clinging to life are the words, “Hey, Vivian. You deserve this. And at least with you gone, no one will steal my yoghurt out of the fridge.”
“P.S. Good luck wherever you wind up.”
Am I a terrible person that it crossed my mind that she might die and never see the card?
Were you seeing other women when we started dating?
Poor thing, she was in surgery for 18 hours. She’s alive, but she’s still in critical condition.
The one bit of good news is they put her in a medically induced coma before she read the card. So, you know, silver linings.
Amy: Of course.
I’m sure it’s lovable.
Okay.
Oh, my gosh.
No. No, it was a mistake.
Now I think you’re flirting with the line. Good news?
You’ll get offered something soon.
Maybe you’ll get hit by a car and die. LOL, right?
Can you get the butter, please?
Then get the other one. Pass the butter.
Fine, Sheldon. You have my undivided attention.
No way.
Well, you wouldn’t want your gaming system to overheat.
Included?
Why would they still be using DDR3? Are they nuts?
Whoa, whoa. Wait a second. Who’s they?
You’re kidding.
This is a nightmare. How will you ever make a decision?
Please pass the butter!
You’re welcome.
Uh, it’s date night. Aren’t you, uh, forgetting something?
No.
I’m proud of you, Sheldon.
Well, that’s got to be a good feeling.
Oh, crap.
You were just a little kid.
How old were you then?
What’s a Zune?
No, what are you doing? No, no, pick that back up. You know it’s good. You did the research.
You know what? How about I buy it for you? How about I buy you both?
Then I’ll buy you a new entertainment centre.
How about this? I’ve heard that if you flip a coin, it will tell you how you actually feel. Because you’ll either be disappointed or excited by the outcome.
So, heads it’s PS4, tails it’s Xbox One.
What is it?
Could have given it back to me. That was a choice.
I can’t feel my legs.
Let’s get you some food. You, You’ll feel better after you eat.
What-what do you want, like, Thai food? A burger?
Raj: Hey. Emily, right?
I, I don’t know if you remember me.
Yes, Rajesh Koothrappali. Look, uh, I just, I wanted to say I’m sorry. Okay? You were, like, the coolest person I ever found online, and I got really nervous and I, I just blew it.
Well, give me a chance, you don’t even know me.
Ah, really? Thank you. Fate has given me a rare second chance, and I swear to Vishnu I’m not gonna blow it. Or normal words followed by a charming smile.

And then after coffee, we went for a walk and she told me she always thought people from India were exotic and mysterious. So, with my mouth, I said, we’re just like anybody else, but with my eyes, I said, straight up, Red, hop on my flying carpet.
Yeah, we have plans this weekend. And if it’s a clear night, I’m gonna lay some romantic astronomy on her.
I can’t do that to Leonard. This is some powerful panty-dropping stuff.
Okay. Penny, two of the brightest stars in the night sky are Altair and Vega. And it is said they were deeply in love but forever separated by the celestial river of the Milky Way.

It is. But once a year, on the seventh day of the seventh month, Vega cries so hard that all the magpies in the world fly up and create a bridge with their wings so the two lovers can be together for a single night of passion.
Uh, Xbox One.
Oh, my goodness.
I just got an e-mail from my ex-girlfriend Lucy. She misses me and wants to get together.
What am I supposed to do? How am I supposed to choose between Emily and Lucy?
I can’t date two women at once. Zero women, that’s my sweet spot.
But what if one of them asks me what I was up to the night before and I was with the other one? Then, what, do I lie?
Any news on your co-worker who’s in the hospital?
Oh, no.
Did he help you make a decision about the movie?

As a matter of fact, I did. I’ve spent so many years living in fear, saying no to new experiences, but from now on, I’m gonna say yes, yes to love, yes to adventure, yes to life. Whatever it may be, the answer’s going to be yes.
You look, you look really pretty tonight.
Thank you. Thanks, thanks. I’m sorry. I can’t do this. My, my ex-girlfriend e-mailed me, and I’m seeing her Saturday, And I’m glad you like it, it’s from J. Crew.
My friends told me it was okay to see more than one person at a time, but it, it feels like I’m being deceitful.
No. I, I have no idea. What would you do?
Well, to be honest, we only went on four dates, hugged twice, kissed once, and there was a handshake loaded with sexual innuendo.
Yeah.
Are you, are you sure? Because this is the part of the night where I’ve said something stupid and the girl usually leaves.
Yeah, but now you make me wonder what’s wrong with you.
Really? Because I’m dating two women is basically the only cool thing I can say about myself.
Emily: From the dating Web site. Your friend e-mailed me because you were afraid to, then you tracked me down and acted like a lunatic?
Uh, don’t worry about it. And if it makes you feel any better, you’re not the weirdest guy I’ve met off the Internet.
Are you getting back together with her?
Uh, usually on first dates, I talk about music and stuff, but I was promised weird, so let’s do this. How serious were you two?
Wait, so, a girl you never slept with sent you an e-mail and you felt so guilty about it that you had to tell me?
We just met. You don’t need to tell me about other people you’re seeing.
Leonard: Yeah. I had higher hopes for a: Monkey See, Monkey Kill. You know, it’s still possible for you to be good in a bad movie.
Howard: Why do you have to choose? Date both of them.
No. Were you seeing other men?
Were you like this when I married you?
Wil Wheaton: Yeah, happy to help. So, what’s going on?
Wil: Well, I have certainly taken some jobs that I’ve been embarrassed by.

Well, it’s tricky. You want to take projects that you’re excited about, but sometimes you also have to pay the bills. When you’re on the set working on something that you just know in your heart is bad, not Star Trek.
Anyway, those jobs can be soul-crushing.
So, I was in Stand By Me when I was a kid, and it was a huge success. The terrible movies I did came after that. I mean, imagine how that feels.

I’m telling you, this business is brutal. To this day, I hate going on auditions. Okay, I walk in, and I can just feel them thinking, he was such a cute kid, what happened to him? And then I don’t get the job, and I can never find out why. Honestly, I get so depressed, there are entire weeks that I can’t even get out of bed.
Store assistant: Oh, I’m sorry, guys, but the store closed five minutes ago.
You’ll have to come back tomorrow. The registers are closed.
